metadata.titleEn: In-situ water quality parameters of the lakes on the Tibetan Plateau (2009-2020)
metadata.description: This dataset provides the in-situ lake water parameters of 124 closed lakes with a total lake area of 24,570 km2, occupying 53% of the total lake area of the TP.These in-situ water quality parameters include water temperature, salinity, pH,chlorophyll-a concentration, blue-green algae (BGA) concentration, turbidity, dissolved oxygen (DO), fluorescent dissolved organic matter (fDOM), and water clarity of Secchi Depth (SD).
metadata.instructions:
The name of the file is "measured water quality data of lakes in Qinghai Tibet Plateau. Docx".
Data reading mode: the files in the data set can be directly opened by office program.

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics of methods used to measure water quality parameters in lakes on the Tibetan Plateau?
Feature Specification.Answer: salinity derived from specific conductance, chlorophyll-a and blue-green algae concentrations measured with total algae fluorescence, temperature measured with temperature sensors, pH measured with pH sensors, dissolved oxygen measured with optical dissolved oxygen sensors, fluorescent dissolved organic matter measured in quinine sulfate units, turbidity measured in Formazin Nephelometric Units, lake water transparency measured with a Secchi disk, sensors positioned 10-20 centimeters below the lake surface

Quantification.Question: What is the total area covered by the lakes on the Tibetan Plateau included in a dataset focused on water quality parameters?

Definition.Question: What is the method for measuring salinity in lake water quality studies on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau?
Definition.Answer: Salinity is measured using conductivity sensors, which provide specific conductance (SpC) that is then converted to salinity.

Comparison.Question: How do the methods for measuring chlorophyll a concentration using total algae fluorescence sensors compare to those for measuring blue-green algae concentration in terms of accuracy and applicability in lakes of the Tibetan Plateau?
Comparison.Answer: Both chlorophyll a and blue-green algae concentrations are measured using total algae fluorescence sensors. These sensors are part of multi-parameter water quality instruments like YSIEXO or HACH, which are submerged 10-20 centimeters below the lake surface. The comparison in terms of accuracy and applicability would depend on the specific sensor calibration and environmental conditions, but both measurements utilize similar technologies and principles.
